other_tests.findings: Diagnosis of disseminated cutaneous glomangiomas was confirmed histologically in 4 family members of 3 different generations.
Exclusion of genetic linkage to chromosome 11q23 for the affected family members.
Positive staining with monoclonal antibodies directed against smooth muscle alpha actin and partially with vimentin, but not with desmin.
Multiple perivascular glomus cells surrounded by a basal lamina and numerous myofilaments, with visible dense bodies and nerve fibers.
An excellent cosmetic result with no reoccurrence after a 3-year follow-up after excision of the glomangioma.
